questions.questionText: The 'let' keyword in JavaScript allows you to declare block-scoped variables.

questions.title: JavaScript Basics
questions.questionText: Which keyword is used to declare a block-scoped variable in JavaScript?

options.text: var – declares function-scoped variables, which can cause issues in block scoping.
let – declares block-scoped variables, reducing scoping problems.
const – declares block-scoped variables whose values cannot be reassigned.
int – a keyword from other languages, but not valid in JavaScript.

questions.title: JavaScript Functions
questions.questionText: Which of the following are valid ways to define a function in JavaScript?

options.text: Function declaration – using the 'function' keyword followed by a name.
Function expression – assigning an anonymous function to a variable.
Arrow function – a concise syntax using '=>' for functions.
Lambda keyword – borrowed from other languages, but not valid in JavaScript.
